messages.title: #CARE4COPS
messages.content: MORE POLICE FUNDING: Philip has been a constant supporter of the police, has always voted for cuts to police funding and continuously presses against the budget cut pressures. Philip was invited to the Police Federation's Annual Conference where he was thanked for his support for the police.
MORE MONEY FOR SCHOOLS: Philip has long campaigned for more money for schools to cope with rising costs, as well as pay rises for teachers and other school staff...
RESPECT DEMOCRACY: Philip remains committed to ensuring that the democratic will of the people is respected and Britain leaves the EU.

TOUGH ON CRIME: Philip believes that criminals are getting unduly lenient sentences. In the past he has successfully argued that sentences and time had extended to reflect the seriousness of the crime.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Philip Davies supports increased funding for police to tackle violent crime; supports 20,000 new police officers and an expansion into stop and search powers.
Philip Davies campaigns for more funding for schools to cope with rising costs, including teacher pay raises, and proposes budget increases for schools.
Philip Davies is committed to respecting the referendum result and ensuring Britain's departure from the European Union.
Philip Davies argues for tougher penalties on crime, emphasizing the need to extend sentences to reflect the seriousness of offenses.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: John McDonnell, Jeremy Corbyn, Diane Abbott

issues.brexitEurope: Philip remains committed to ensuring that the democratic will of the people is respected and Britain leaves the EU.
issues.education: MORE MONEY FOR SCHOOLS: Philip has long campaigned for more money for schools to cope with rising costs, as well as pay rises for teachers and other school staff...

contactInformation.address: First Floor, 3 Manor Lane, Shipley, BD18 3EA

images.caption: Do you really want these three running the country?
